issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
In one of the GA runs there was a case where the CLC did not send the CC a doAssignAddress so the instance did not receive a public IP. There was a rollback exception during the run preparation but not 100% sure if thats the cause.

In the CLC logs:
{code}
2013-01-29 23:38:04  INFO | Finished executing: losetup /dev/loop0 //var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/vol-BD8D3EEC
2013-01-29 23:38:04  INFO | Result of: losetup /dev/loop0 //var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/vol-BD8D3EEC stdout:

fields.summary: CLC not sending doAssignAddress to CC, found javax.persistence.RollbackException: Error while committing the transaction

comments.body: Is there any progress on this one or any more investigation? I wonder if in some way is related with euca-5039: in that case the issue were a bit more dramatic (instances couldn't start).
